comments.body: can you reference the duplicates section itself?
I reference it right above here I think, on line 56.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +58,62 @@The ``allows_duplicate_labels`` flag is stored in the new :attr:`DataFrame.flags`
attribute. This stores global attributes that apply to the *pandas object*. This
differs from :attr:`DataFrame.attrs`, which stores information that applies to
the dataset.

comments.body: Is "externally" shared axes a standard term?

No, hence the quotes. MPL overloading the term "axes" is problem:

Twinned axes were losing their tick labels which should only happen to all but the last row or column of axes shared between axes (:issue:`33819`)
I should add that this is explained more thoroughly in the linked Issue #33819

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +332,336 @@- Bug in :meth:`DataFrame.plot` was rotating xticklabels when ``subplots=True``, even if the x-axis wasn't an irregular time series (:issue:`29460`)
- Bug in :meth:`DataFrame.plot` where a marker letter in the ``style`` keyword sometimes causes a ``ValueError`` (:issue:`21003`)
- Twinned axes were losing their tick labels which should only happen to all but the last row or column of 'externally' shared axes (:issue:`33819`)

Groupby/resample/rolling
